H0.text: The speed and direction of the object will both change as long as the forces acting on it remain balanced.

H1.text: The speed and direction of the object will remain constant as long as the forces acting on it remain balanced.

H2.text: The speed will change, but the direction will remain constant as long as the forces acting on the object remain balanced.

H3.text: The speed will remain constant, but the direction will change, when an object moves through space with balanced forces acting on it and those forces remain balanced.

A4.text: When the net force on a body is equal to zero, then by Newton's second law, the body does not accelerate.
